title: Congressional Republicans Begin to Look Beyond Trump
summary: Election defeats earlier this month and the approach of 2026 have G.O.P. lawmakers cautiously asserting themselves.

title: Trump Calls Democrats’ Military Video ‘Seditious Behavior, Punishable by Death’
summary: President Trump was reacting to a video that reminded members of the military that they are not supposed to obey illegal orders.

title: Trump Calling Reporter ‘Piggy’ Was ‘Frankness,’ White House Says
summary: Karoline Leavitt, the White House press secretary, addressed for the first time a schoolyard insult that President Trump lobbed at a Bloomberg News reporter last week.

title: Coast Guard Says Swastika and Noose Displays Are No Longer Hate Incidents
summary: A new servicewide policy recasts swastikas and nooses as “politically divisive,” revises harassment provisions and deletes protections for transgender troops.

title: The A.I. Boom Has Found Another Gear. Why Can’t People Shake Their Worries?
summary: It is a time of superlatives in the tech industry, with historic profits, stock prices and deal prices. It’s enough to make some people very nervous.

title: Anxiety Over A.I. Spending Returns to Global Markets
summary: A sharp reversal in Asian stocks, after a rally fueled by Nvidia’s strong earnings, underscores how fears of an A.I. bubble are driving broad market swings.

title: Job Gains Disguise Weakness Beyond Service Industries
summary: The unemployment rate rose in September as more people looked for jobs, according to data delayed by the government shutdown.

title: U.S. Manufacturers to Benefit as GE Appliances Shifts Production
summary: The company, now owned by a Chinese conglomerate, is investing $150 million in 19 American suppliers across 10 states.

title: Zelensky Says Ukraine Ready to ‘Honestly’ Engage With U.S. Peace Plan
summary: The proposal, which the White House confirmed on Thursday without providing details, echoes many long-held Russian demands.

title: U.S. Ran a War Game on Ousting Maduro. Venezuela Fell Into Chaos.
summary: An official U.S. government exercise during President Trump’s first term forecast turmoil and potential violence in a post-Maduro Venezuela.

title: Frida Kahlo Portrait Sells for $55 Million, Setting Her Auction Record
summary: The surrealistic self-portrait was made in 1940, a turbulent year in the Mexican artist’s life as her health and marriage deteriorated.

title: After Syria’s 14-Year Civil War, a Search for Victims Leads to Mass Graves
summary: More than 100,000 people disappeared during the 13-year civil war. To bring closure to some of their families, the new government faces the challenging task of exhuming remains from scores of burial sites.

title: Trump and Mamdani Are Meeting for the First Time. Will They Play Nice?
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, will go to the White House on Friday. The stakes are high for the city.

title: Cheney Remembered for Transforming National Security and Standing Against Trump
summary: As the former vice president was honored at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday, many eyes were focused on who came — and who did not.

title: Miss Hall’s Students Accused a Teacher of Sexual Abuse, But Prosecutors Won’t Charge Him
summary: Despite evidence of sexual abuse by a Massachusetts teacher, prosecutors said no criminal conduct occurred. Now survivors are trying to change consent laws they say “offered cover” to their abuser.

title: Netflix, Comcast and Paramount Submit Warner Bros. Discovery Bids
summary: The outcome of the sale could alter the trajectory of the entertainment business.

title: Researcher’s Smuggling Arrest Casts Light on Dispute Over Chinese Students
summary: As some lawmakers press U.S. universities to curtail ties with China, a postdoctoral student’s prosecution raises questions about how big the danger actually is.

title: After 167 Years in New York, a Priceless Coin Collection Heads to Toledo
summary: The doubloons, dollars and denarii of the American Numismatic Society will leave their overlooked home in Manhattan for a more welcoming headquarters on the campus of the Toledo Museum of Art.

title: Trump’s National Guard Blunder
summary: A brief history of the National Guard in Washington.

title: I’m in Venezuela. This Is the True Cost of Trump’s Gunboat Diplomacy.
summary: Trump’s show of force toward Venezuela has created a disastrous political trap — for Venezuelans most of all.

title: Do You Use A.I. for College Application Advice?
summary: We want to hear about it.

title: Representative Eric Swalwell Will Run for California Governor
summary: Representative Eric Swalwell, a Democrat, is likely to emphasize his history of fighting President Trump, an approach that many Democratic voters say they want their elected officials to take.

title: Mexico Wins Miss Universe Pageant Marred by Scandal
summary: Fátima Bosch was crowned in Thailand on Friday. The competition got off to a rocky start this month when she briefly walked out after being scolded by an organizer.

title: ‘The Age of Disclosure,’ Documentary About U.F.O.s, Gets a Congressional Audience
summary: “The Age of Disclosure,” a documentary featuring government and military officials, was screened for a bipartisan group of members of the House of Representatives.
